dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my fault. I send you out to  watch scum drool all over the love  of your life, then I wonder why you  seered. It's my fault. The tooth is  on me. But no more. I'm 'reassigning'  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to drive another girl,  Max. The only reason I'm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck do you think you're  talking to? This ain't a fucking  democracy. You want out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't I put food on you're table? I  sponsor your training, I take care  of your girl and her little baby. I  even pay that deadbeat friend of  yours to push a goddamn broom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you wanna shut up and listen and  hear what I got to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a way we make everybody happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We try something out. There's someone  I'm in business with named Ruiz. I  want you to accompany him on a drop. (off Bobby's look) Just as scenery. Ruiz has his boys.   I just want a big guinea with a busted  up face to give him a deep bench. As  a deterrent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruiz knows about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruiz wants to go alone, but it's not  up to Ruiz. It's up to me, and I  like a sure thing. Just go and we're  square on the tooth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Ricky? He'd jump at the  opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky? Ricky 'I lost the truck' Ricky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told him you liked him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was before he lost my carpet  cleaning van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll work it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know the kid, and what little  I do scares me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's good people, Mr. Reuben. I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You vouch for him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The exchange has taken on a gravity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lighter) How 'bout this. If you're in, he's  in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta tell you, Mr. Reuben, I'm  not comfortable getting in any deeper.  It's one thing to look after Jess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're ready to move up. Christ, the  way you busted up the place, you're  doing worse already. May as well get  paid instead of punished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that I don't appreciate the  offer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favor. Think about it. Is  that too much too ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Okay. I'll think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ESTABLISHING SHOT of the mural for the HOLLYWOOD SHEIKS  football team. Bobby and Ricky walk past the empty stands watching the HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL TEAM practice. Ricky dr from a brown paper bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't need guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't say we need guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He implied it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't imply about something like  that. You lay it out on the table.  Besides, I'm not taking the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME CUT. Ricky and Bobby watch the field from behind the concrete stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the opportunity of a lifetime.  What are you? Nuts? You've been  waiting for this kind of opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You've been waiting for this  kind of opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sparking up) Damn right, I have. You think I like  living on fucking Yucca? We do a  good job on this, we're in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to boxing? I thought  we made a vow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Who we kidding? I know I suck,  and I held you up for ten rounds --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I got three inches on you.   You wouldn't have landed a punch if  I didn't let you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna go right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll beat your ass --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They slap-box in the empty stairs. This attracts the atte of the team and the COACH, who has walked up to the botto of the stands. He calls out to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky! Bobby! Cut that shit out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the boxing going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shitty) He's 5-5-1.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes time, Bobby. You always had  the heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about me coach? Did I have heart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coach throws a look and walks back to practice, blowi his whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We look good this year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll kill Fairfax this year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still can't believe you missed the  fucking team bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your first start at DB, it's against  Fairfax, and you miss the fucking  bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we delivering?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not delivering shit. Ruiz is  delivering something, and whatever  it is is his business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this fucking Ruiz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maxie says he runs a tight ship. I  wouldn't fuck with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some Mexican? How much could he weigh?  A buck fifty, tops? I'd kick his  fucking ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at watch) I gotta pick up the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you always get stuck taking  care of the kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not even yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby pulls into a RTA bus stop in front of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby's Trans Am is parked in the bus stop in front of th school. Ricky is on the phone, oblivious, as a black METE MAID gives the car a ticket. Bobby walks down the walkway with Chloe, Jessica's daughter, and takes the ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He helps Chloe into the back. Chloe is silent and clutche dried macaroni glued to a paper plate and spray-painted  silver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: ticket) Nice work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh... (on cell phone) Yeah, yeah... No. No. I'll be there. (hangs up) You gotta get me to the Magic Castle  at four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you unlock my phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried your ATM PIN. I gotta kill  an hour. Let's grab a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chloe) Seat belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky's not wearing one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky, can you put on a seat belt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, man. It wrinkles my shit. Let's  grab a fuckin beer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, man, not in front of the baby.  Put on your seat belt before I get  another ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clipping in) Jesus Christ, fine. Alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? Now everyone's got one on. (re: macaroni plate) What do you got there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A elephant seal. Where's mommy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's, uh, sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's daytime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy works hard so you can have all  your pretty clothes. Don't you like  your pretty clothes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show uncle Ricky what you made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's grab a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ESTABLISHING SHOT of the storefront ceramics workshop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby paints a CERAMIC PLATE as Chloe does the best she c painting a frog in this do-it-yourself crafts store. Rick looks out of place as he lights a Marlboro and bitches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't we just grab a goddamn  beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised Chloe we'd come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, give me a break. Look at her.   She don't even know where the hell  she is. She'd have more fun at  Bordner's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not taking her to a bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? I grew up in bars. It's fun  for a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG FEMALE SALESPERSON approaches Ricky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, there's no smoking in the  store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? You serve food?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Store policy. And you can't sit  at a station without purchasing a  ceramic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you believe this shit? Fine.   Give me an ashtray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She brings him an unpainted ceramic ashtray from a displa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What color paints would you like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SNUFFS the CIGARETTE out in the ashtray in the palm of her hand. She puts it down and leaves in a huff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, bro, we're on the  verge. He's reaching out to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chloe stops painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not doing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Did she say something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants you to paint the ashtray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not painting the fu --, I'm not  painting the ashtray. And frogs aren't  purple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a poison arrow tree frog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you paint the damn thing. Why  do you gotta be such a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Here, look. I'm painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He haphazardly paints. Chloe resumes her task.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max won't let me drive Jess to dance  anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's driving her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This paint sucks. The white shows  through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby pulls up. The WIFE of the Amalfi homeowner is  precariously waiting and smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the woman from..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) She really liked the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pops out, and the woman corrals him into a room. Bobby pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica is half made up and half dressed. Little Chloe si at the kitchen table twirling a spoon around her head. He mom is haphazardly cooking a rushed supper. Bobby sits  watching TV in his sweats in the adjoining living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, sweety, mommy's in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want grilled cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy has to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, sweety. Don't be a little shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby approaches and takes the pan. He kisses Jess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go finish getting ready. I'll take  care of dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shuffles off. Bobby puts up some water and heats a pa adding oil. Garlic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not my daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna bust my horns, or you want  spaghetti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want spaghettis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pours in a can of sliced olives in with the capers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better watch everything I'm doing.  You know why? Because that's how you  learn to cook. I watched my grandma  cook every night. That's how I  learned. If you can't cook, then you  gotta go out to eat every night,  then you spend all your money on  food. And when you eat in restaurants,  the cooks scratch their ass and touch  the food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a knock on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you get that, baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does. It's Horrace. Bobby's surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up? Jess ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You driving her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be out in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrace tries to walk in. Bobby stands in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firm) She'll be out in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jess hurries in, clipping earrings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya Ho. Come in. I'll just be a  minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws Bobby a look as he slides by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some shit smells good in this  motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby's cooking. He's the best. Whip  him up something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Whip me up something. I'm hungry  as a motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jess hurries out, brushing her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your mouth in front of the  baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby joins Jess in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby enters, boiling over with opinions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way that cocksucker's driving  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if you didn't go Rambo every  time I did a lapdance, you'd still  be doing it yourself. Meantime, I  gotta feed my little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maxie's fucking with me. He put you  with the spook to get under my skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho's a good guy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho's a fucking pimp! He encourages  Wendy to turn tricks. And she's his  fucking wife!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. He'll hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good! It'll save me the trouble of  repeating myself. He's not fucking  driving you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me, Bobby. This is my job.  It puts a roof over me and my daughter  and you for as long as you want to  stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the bills. I can't. I'm not  gonna put my daughter through what I  went through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll support you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max offered to stake me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well Max offers a lot of things.  And I got news for you. He's not the  sweet old man you think he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crosses to the door, abruptly ending the discussion. Bobby grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She needs a family. A dad. I'll give  her what you never had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get my hopes up. If I quit,  what then? I can't go through this  again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby enters to find Horrace eating the pasta and feeding Chloe the grilled cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon girl. Eat up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not backing down) Excuse --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts the  conflict) C'mon, Ho. We're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. We got money to make. See you  around, Bobby. You make a good  puttanesca. Mmmmm-mmmm. You should  make that shit for a living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave. Bobby looks at Chloe, who spits out the chees sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DIALOGUE PRELAPS over a BLACK SCREEN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the last time I speak to  either of you in person about work  related matters. All of our  interactions in the future will be  social. If you have any questions  about anything work related, you  will direct them to Ruiz. He has my  full confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE UP on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max sits behind his desk as he briefs Bobby and Ricky. Bo wears sweats. Ricky wears a suit. Max speaks with a direc suggesting gravity. He lays down two MANILA ENVELOPES. Th two guys pick them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything you need or need to know  is in these envelopes. Do not --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky starts to tear his envelope open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: open the envelopes until you have  left this office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky sheepishly draws a length of scotch tape from Max's desk set dispenser. Mid-pull, he becomes self-conscious and asks for permissi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I borrow a piece of --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Open the fuckin things.  You should each find fifteen hundred --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tear open the envelopes. Ricky's flies apart, sendin stack of crisp new Franklin HUNDREDS falling from the air like a New England autumn morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: dollars in c-notes, a numeric pager,  a double-A battery, and a first class  round-trip ticket to JFK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to New York?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with detectable  condescension) Yes. You're going to New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the money. Where do we bring the  money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That money is your per diem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where do we bring it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To keep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, for expenses and such. Now,  you'll be contacted on your pager as  to where you should go. You each  have been given an extra battery, so  there is absolutely no excuse as to  why a page would not be immediately  returned. Am I making myself  abundantly clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will not carry any other pagers  with you. You will not carry anything,  for that matter, that I have not  just given you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about my keys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can carry your keys. You will  not mention my name or imply that  you are in my employ. You will not  speak to anyone while you are working.  When you are not working, you are  considered to be 'on call' and  available twenty-four hours a day.  This means you will not get drunk or  do anything that will prevent you  from operating in a professional  manner. There is already a number in  your pager's memory. It is a car  service. When they ask you what  account, you will respond: 'Cardiff  Giant.' They will pick you up and  take you anywhere you need to go. In  other words, there is no reason why  you should not reach any destination  that you will be called upon to reach  within fifteen minutes. Do you see a  pattern forming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not you. I want Ricky to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me how it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want... Why are you picking on  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you lost my fucking carpet  cleaning van and I don't like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already told you, I parked it for  five minutes and I locked it with  the club --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts) You want us to be wherever you want  us to be, ASAP, no questions asked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, wait, what are we dropping off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of those cool over cranked tracking shots of the two  guys walking purposefully that means we're really getting down to business now. A cool song is playing. Ricky and B each hold a manila envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby lays his envelope on the x-ray conveyor belt. He wa through the metal detector. He passes the check. Ricky does the same. The ALARM goes off. Bobby looks  concerned. Ricky pulls a ring of KEYS and drops it in the tray with a look to Bobby. Bobby looks relieved. Ricky is dressed to the nines: Dark blazer over a dark sweater.  B more casual, wears dark slacks, a dark shirt and a gold h around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They check their boarding stubs and sit in the plush firs class seats in the almost empty cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Can you believe this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, man. Maxie fuckin takes care of  you when you're in. Beats cleaning  carpets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, don't bother --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky rings the service chime. An attractive young FLIGHT ATTENDANT arrives. She has a tray of champagne and orange juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning off the  service light) Champagne or orange juice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky takes a champagne. She smiles and walks away. He st mid-gulp and rings the bell again. She turns with a smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning off the  service light) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, uh, what's the movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in your copy of Hemispheres. I  believe it's Mickey Blue Eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you the list of videos, if  you don't mind, I'll offer the other  passengers a beverage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. How much are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The videos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're up front. Everything's free  up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles. He smiles. She walks away. He rings the bell  again. She returns with a strained smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning off the  service light) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drinks are free, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (waits) Would you care for another one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes another champagne and she crosses to leave. He c after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have a Cutty on the rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that? You can drink as much  as you want up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not supposed to get drunk.   We're on call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless we're supposed to whack out  the fuckin' pilot, I don't think  we're gonna have to work in the next  five hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to show up hammered.  We're supposed to be representing  Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'll represent alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rings the bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut that shit out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strained politeness) Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I operate out of the Chicago O'Hare  hub. Can I help you with anything  else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Me and my boy here are gonna  be in New York overnight. I want you  to pass the word around to the honeys  back in business class that you all  got plans for tonight. I'm talkin' a  California style, Tupac, gangster  pool party back at the hotel. And  make that drink a double.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him for a BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, asshole, I don't care if  you're the Sultan of Brunei, no man  talks to me like that. Now you can  either learn some manners or I can  make a formal complaint to the airport  authorities and we can sort this out  while you're waiting stand-by for  the next flight to Kennedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks away. He turns off the bell light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PASSENGERS file off the plane and out of the gate. Bo walks out purposefully. Ricky staggers slightly. He got h money's worth. Bobby checks his pager and Ricky scans the crowd through his buzz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. No new pages. I don't even  know where the fuck we're supposed  to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should call for a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Look. There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hulking Italian DRIVER holds up a sign reading 'CARDIFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cardiff Giant.' That's us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He said that's our account  with the car service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach the driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I, uh, think that's us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soho Grand, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to the Soho Grand hotel,  right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure. All I know is the  account is Cardiff Giant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Yeah. You're staying at the Soho  Grand. You got anything checked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traveling light. I like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it nice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Soho Grand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're from LA, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll love it.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Jimmy walks them out and up to a black STRETCH LIMO. He o the door. Ricky's eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flight attendant who told Ricky off rolls her overnig bag past them. Ricky can't help himself. He calls after h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You missed out, lady! We're staying  at the Soho Grand! I'd give you a  ride in my limo, but I gotta stretch  my shit out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ride in the back. Ricky fucks with the buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So whenever we want...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Grab one of the cards behind  you. Call that number. It's my cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're our own private guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I handle most of Cardiff Giant's  stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know my pager number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I thought you might.   Any idea what the job is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 'job?' Alls I know is I'm taking  you to the Soho Grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the Soho Grand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LIMO drives past a vista of the luminescent SKYLINE. The lights twinkle through the highway emissions. The  SOUNDTRACK takes a decidedly carnivorous, urban turn.

dialogues.speaker: DAY INTO D
dialogues.text: The limo drives through the streets of the city. Steam co out of a manhole cover (if we can afford it).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ESTABLISHING SHOT of the trendy architectural hotel. The  limo pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young black BELLMAN walks Bobby into his suite. They ar followed by Ricky. The room is beautiful. Blonde wood pan is offset by black and white photos of New York's past. M furniture and a mirrored wet bar give the suite a luxurio feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And here is the key to the mini- bar. Room and tax has been picked up  by Cardiff Giant, as well as one  fifty in incidentals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's 'incidentals?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone, room service, mini-bar. Any  additional expense. If you need  anything you can push the button  marked 'Concierge', and they'll be  able to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands the bellman a tip. He then pulls out a card key beckons Ricky. Bobby dials phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Mr. Slade, you're in room 315.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me the key. I'm gonna stay  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it a good room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can take you down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me. Wait, here... Do you  have change of a hundred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not on me, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Take it. Bring me back eighty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you very much, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it the good room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the suites are about the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Just tell me. It'll save  all the trouble of you showing me  all the rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly, the suites are all about  the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I gave you forty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's as good a suite as we have,  unless you want two bedrooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's cool. Bring me back eighty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the place to go tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far as...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nightlife. Where's the hot ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah 'women.' If I was a fag I could  get laid in a subway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Forum's pretty hot  tonight. It might be hard to get in,  though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about me getting in.  Just tell me where it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on West Broadway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, take care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks again. I'll bring up your  change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bellman leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi girls, It's Bobby. I'm here safe  and sound. I'm just calling to say I  love you. I'd leave my number, but  you know you can't call me here, so  I'll try you later. Uncle Ricky wants  to say hi... (he won't) He says hi. Be home soon. Love you.   Bye bye. (hangs up) Why don't you want to say hi? She  likes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky dials the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you calling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh... Hello, room service?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, bring up two burgers and a  couple of Heinekens. I'm in room...   How'd you know? Oh. Yeah. How long?   Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much? Okay. Make it fifteen  minutes and you can add on a ten  dollar tip. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty-six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, man. Plus ten?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. On my fucking room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. You got one-fifty. You heard  the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky, who knows how long we're gonna  have to be here. We gotta make it  last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. I'll put it on my room. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. Just be smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But let me tell you, man, I don't  like your attitude already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh really. Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just got moved up in the world.   You gotta let go of that blue collar  mentality that was drummed into your  head. You gotta start owning it man,  or they'll smell you a mile away  like a cheap suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's gonna smell me a mile away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't play dumb. You know what I'm  talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up the phone and pulls out Jimmy's card. Bobby h up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're not calling Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact I was. You got a  problem with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here representing Max. You're  acting like a Puerto Rican on the  fifteenth of the month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think Maxie doesn't want us to  roll hard? Why do you think he gave  us all this bread? Or the number on  the pager? We gotta represent him by  showing some class. The man's got an  operation. How does it reflect on  him if we nickel and dime it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dials. Bobby hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on West Broadway. We can walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't want to walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky starts to dial. Bobby takes the CARD and RIPS IT UP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky DIVES on Bobby, and a huge ugly BRAWL begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky and Bobby stand side by side at the front of the li as Ricky tries to talk his way past the velvet rope. They look horrible. All their cuts have reopened, their faces swollen, and their only set of clothes are now disheveled and torn. Ricky talks a steady stream of bullshit, but th DOORMAN will have none of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...How 'bout Jimmy? You know Jimmy  the driver? Cardiff Giant? You ever  deal with them? Cardiff Giant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky and Bobby are poured tea by a frilly SERVER. A LONG BEAT of SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horseshit. 'Try the China Club. 'Fuck  you, asshole. I think it was a fag  bar. Didn't it look like a fag bar.

dialogues.speaker: BEEBEEBEEBEEP
dialogues.text: ...They look at each other. BOTH of their PAGERS are goin off simultaneously...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: They run up to a phone stand. An HISPANIC KID is on it.   They wait and listen as he talks baby-talk with his woman

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taptaptap... No dial tone. He lifts the receiver higher. The wires have been RIPPED OUT of the base. They look at next phone. An HISPANIC KID is on it. They wait and liste as he talks baby-talk with his woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Mmmm, that sounds good...   Uhu...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, we need to make a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So's this. (in phone) Hey baby... Oh, nothing. What were  you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, man, we really gotta...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I be off in a minute. (phone) Say again...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky GRABS THE RECEIVER and BEATS HIM across the head wi it. The poor kid falls out of frame, and Ricky yells into the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll call back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up and they both fumble with their pagers and  pockets. Bobby puts in a quarter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. It's thirty-five cents. You  got a dime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down to the kid out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a dime, bro?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two banged-up Angelenos clean themselves up in the fo down vanity mirrors. Jimmy is their driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Jimmy, you know where this address  is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'll find it. It's in Harlem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harlem? What is it, a restaurant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know where you're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Just the cross streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this is the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo settles on a desolate street in Harlem. There is nothing going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can wait around if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's cool, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get out and the limo leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand outside. They look awful. They look with curio as cars pass. Ricky lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly did they say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said a hundred thirty-fifth and  Twelfth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't say an address?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you what they said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd they know who you were?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They asked who it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they said more than the address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They asked who I was, then told  me what corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bullshit, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck do you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BROUGHAM slowly passes. They pause. It goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck do you have to complain  about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Tell me. What's so fucking  horrible about this gig? You've been  crawling up my ass for six months to  get your name on Maxie's list, and  here we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, man, I never met Ruiz, okay?   I don't know what the fuck I'm picking  up, what the fuck I'm dropping off,  who the fuck I'm meeting. All I know  is Maxie's still pissed at me cause  I sold his fucking van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sold it? I thought they stole  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sold it, stole it, whatever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, give me a break. Don't tell me  you feel bad for the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me. I vouched  for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. I'll do right by him. You  know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just don't fucking get it, do  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know he fucks all his girls,  don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that supposed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, that's what I heard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got something to say --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby grabs him, and is about to start another scrap, whe the distant roar of a fleet of JAPANESE SUPER BIKES draws near. The pack screams up to the duo. There are a dozen black men, on Ninjas, and they all wear black Nazi-style helmets. The two men freeze, and the bikes settle in around them. One BIKER pulls up to Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They flew you all the way out here  to cook me up some fuckin puttanesca?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby recognizes the biker is Horrace, from LA. He is  relieved, but not pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His names Horrace. Horrace, this is  Ricky Slade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up. You all ready to meet  Ruiz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrace throws him a helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby now rides bitch behind Ho, and Ricky clutches the b of a buff shirtless BROTHER. The bikes rip down the uptow streets with a ferocity that scares pedestrians. An urban drum track rattles the SOUNDTRACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horde of bikers rumble under a red, white, and green  banner strung from street lamps marking the start of Ital turf. The businesses are all closed or closing. Looks are drawn from locals as the outsiders chug by at a respectful trawl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pack pulls away leaving only Bobby, Ricky, and Horrac Ho leans his Ninja to rest next to a custom Buell Harley- Davidson cafe racer. Bobby can't help but stare at the rare piece of machinery They enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The restaurant is now closed, but RUIZ sits in a rear boo on a Nokia. He is a slim, young black man with a tight ro fro. He wears a rolex, but, other than that, nothing flas He's wearing dark Gucci slacks, a black pullover crew-nec shirt, and a black, red and orange racing leather jacket. must have pull here, because 'Between the Sheets' is play over the stereo of this bare-bones, Italian eatery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on cell) Nah, man. Nah. Too risky. I don't  like it... I want out... It's too  risky... Listen, man, we made a lot  of money together on this one, but  it's over. Shit's gonna come down...   Well, then, you got my blessing. I'm  selling my end. This internet shit's  too volatile. I'll keep my block of  Microsoft, but I'm taking profits on  Yahoo and all the portal stocks. The  bubble's gonna pop, man... Alright,  peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three men approach Ruiz's table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? This is Maxie's cavalry?   Who the fuck swole you up like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Ricky both point to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. If that shit don't beat all.   Maxie sent me two fuckin broke ass  swole up guineas from the West side.  I coulda signed up some hard local  guineas for beer money. Ain't that  right, Leo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEO, the white-haired Italian waiter nods in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. You boys want anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, bring us four fernet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four fernet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'll take a strega.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, motherfucker? You drinking  'the witch' after dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That fernet tastes like tar.   My grandfather tried to give me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some fuckin guineas he sent me. It's  midnight and the motherfucker's  ordering an apertif.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a digestif.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strega's an apertif.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Bring me a Cynar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nigger, please. Don't even order  that artichoke shit. West side  guineas. Forget the drinks, Leo. We  gotta roll. What do I owe you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, man. You need anything, you  call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You rode?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hits speed dial) Jimmy? Ruiz. Pick up Maxie's guineas  at LUNA and bring them to Spa. (hangs up) Jimmy's bringing the car around. Me  and Ho rode sleds. We'll meet you at  Spa in the VIP room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Spa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy knows. 13th Street. We'll meet  you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave. Ricky and Bobby sit and wait. Ricky addresses Leo after they kick their bikes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you like that fucking  moulinyan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you two should wait out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky and Bobby sit in the back as Jimmy drives them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This shit's sketchy. Why do they  drop us in the middle of nowhere to  have the guy we're supposed to meet  come meet us just to tell us we have  to meet the same guy somewhere else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I thought you understood and I  was just missing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missing what? He didn't say shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you know Horrace. What did  you get off him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I 'get?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. What vibe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I detected no vibe other than that  Ruiz thinks you're a fucking idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, fuck him, man. Calling us  guineas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you give a shit what he calls  us? He's not our friend. Let's just  get this shit over with and go home.  What's this place we're going to,  Jimmy?

dialogues.text: I swear to God, I'll fucking puke.
