dialogues.text: (obliging) Hey, Jimmy, where they taking us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Where they gonna whack us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky looks at him without an ounce of humor. Jimmy laugh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they're whacking you, they're  doing it in style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo pulls up to...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Jimmy lets them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAITRE D' leads them past an orgy of a BUFFET. Everyt looks sickening to our bloated drunks. The head of a whit in particular makes an impression on the boys. They are lead to a table joining Ruiz and Horrace, who ar both dressed appropriately for a society brunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, where the fuck you  been all night? You look like you  got shit out in the gorilla house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this shit's funny, Ho?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it's funny, motherfucker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, Ruiz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WAITER shows up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't 'easy Ruiz' me. Y'all turned a  Easter egg hunt into a butt-fuck-a- thon. (to waiter) Bring me four eggs Benedict and a  mimosa. You all want mimosas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ill) Nah, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four mimosas. (to guys) You'll love them. So here's the plan.  I didn't say shit to Maxie, cause  the man has acute angina, and I don't  want to get him all worked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a cute what...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bad heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't tell him shit. He worries  too much. I love that old Jew, but  he's gonna kill himself worrying. We  started this shit, and we're gonna  finish it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's gonna outfit us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outfit? What's he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want us strapped, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last thing I want is you with a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, the Welsh dude --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Red Dragon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut it, man. Shut it. Tom is a  square. He don't but dabble in shit.   Maxie had me hook up a loan-back  with him, through an Austrian passbook  account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, we're talking money laundering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you tell Peter Jennings to shut  up and fucking listen. The shit's as  routine as you get. I coulda turned  it over offshore in a week, but Maxie  likes to do it all his way. Safe. I  coulda dropped the bag alone. It's  only two hundred G's. But he sent  you all. So I can either send you  home and tell Maxie, or we can flush  the toilet one more time and hope it  all goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm your soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now listen. The gig couldn't be  simpler. You carry the money to the  Welshman, he checks it, hands you  his marker, you're done. The washed  money goes directly to Maxie. Long  as you hand off the bag, you're tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the drop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You three are gonna meet him for  dinner. Find out if and where. Now  any of you motherfuckers got anything  else to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When all this is over and we're not  working for Maxie, I'd love to run  into you on the street. (beat of silence) Why aren't you coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's none of your fucking business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby tries to hold his shit together as he wanders down mirrored hallway. He arrives at a DOOR. He opens the door find a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...windowless dining room, painted with grotesque greener He quickly ducks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby splashes water on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrace, Bobby and Ricky walk and talk through the pictur park. Ricky picks at a tuft of cotton candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why isn't Ruiz coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Welsh dude is tripping on Ruiz  cause he's a Shot Caller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Shot Caller. A boss, a Capo. He's  running shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO another view of the bears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Welsh dude, sees all these niggers  in perms and diamonds and shit, he  gets nervous. But you motherfuckers,  he just laughs. All beat up in your  babaloo suit like Fruitpie the  Magician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we just go eat with him and that's  gonna solve everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, you just gotta settle your  shit down. You gotta go and say all  that 'Red Dragon' shit. Make him  think he's on Barretta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you were doing any better  shucking and jiving like you were  waiting for wings outside the Quick  and Split.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO another view of the bears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We go and hang out with the dude,  make him happy, drink some tea,  whatever it takes, until he feels  comfortable enough to bring it up on  his own. We make the drop, go home  to California.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is this happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands him matchbook) We meet at the Globe on Park Avenue  at six forty-five. I'll see you then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrace walks away, leaving Bobby and Ricky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's check out the penguins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The penguin house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. You want to look at  fucking penguins now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Let's look at the penguins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear what he just said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. We're here. We may as well  go to the penguin house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tired and I'm scared, and I'm  not looking at fucking penguins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Ricky watch the PENGUINS frolic in their arctic habitat. The silence is broken by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't need guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretty sure we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I listened extremely carefully.   Nothing was even vaguely implied. He  even laughed in your face when you  asked him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the more reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't even know where to get  one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna bet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't even get a hand job  from bridge and tunnel posse, how  you gonna get a gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cause you decided to get all  tired all of a sudden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was six in the fucking morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Float me a hundred bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna see how fast I get a gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out of money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you have left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty bucks?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to the fifteen hundred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You coulda picked up a tab every  once in a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did! I paid for half the fuckin  drinks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I did. You asshole! What about  the room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They only cover one fifty in  incidentals. You've been ordering  fucking... Motherfucker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to count out his cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fucking vouched for you. I vouched  for you and you fucked me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This shit's peanuts compared to what  we're gonna make with Maxie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky. I'm trying to save this money.  Understand? I'm trying to make it so  my girlfriend doesn't have to grind  her ass into other men's erections  so her daughter can go to private  school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is horseshit. It coulda been so  easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get some sleep. That's what we  need, man. Sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How we gonna sleep? We only got a  few hours til dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just go now and wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three and a half hours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to take any more chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just go get guns, I'd feel  better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fuck around. You're gonna get  us all killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about it: You knocked out that  Jewish kid's tooth, cost him eight  grand, maybe more. Maybe lost his  whole line of clientele? He knows  you're fucking up Jess' dancing, and  I got a feeling he knows I stole his  carpet cleaning van by the way he  looks at me. He can't kill us in LA  cause that leads to too many  questions. So he flies us out here  first class for a 'drop' that's turned  into whatever? He can make us  disappear out here real nice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you get this shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scenario B. I think I'm getting under  Ruiz's skin. I'm no dummy. He doesn't  like how it went down with the Red  Drag -- Welshman, whatever. Now I  got Fruitpie the Magician telling me  I can't call my man Max? And that  Welshman's sketchy.  Whatever, I  don't know where it's coming, which  way it's coming from, I'm telling  you one thing right now, I'm not  gonna be late for the dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not getting a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is on the CAR PHONE beside Ricky. He leaves a messa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi girls. It's Bobby. Can't seem to  get a hold of you. Gonna be home  soon. I miss you. Chloe, Uncle Ricky's  here. He wants to say hello. Say hi  to Chloe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky fights with him in whispers, then finally takes the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Princess. It's Ricky. I hope you're  doing good sweety. Everyone's okay.  Nobody's hurt... Talk to you soon.  Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky and Bobby look horrible. They stare in silence drin coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME LAPSE of the two guys shifting and resting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrace arrives with the Welshman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. They're together. You telling  me this ain't a set-up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom. How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, fine. And you were...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Ricky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, right. The 'thugs.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a laugh. The tension is slowly dissipating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where is...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruiz? Oh, he ain't here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, see, Maxie just asked him to  set that shit up as a favor. He, you  know, he tied in with the club. Set  us up so, you know, you feel at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I didn't care for the club  much. And, I must say, I didn't care  for him either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he ain't gonna be around no  more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pity. What's say we have a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky and Bobby can barely keep they're eyes open. Horrac seems equally irritated as the Welshman drains what appea to be his fifth pint of ale. Ricky is preoccupied by a  projected image on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the greatest fucking country  in the world. I love this fucking  place. I mean the food, the women,  the fucking curbs. This country has  the highest fucking curbs in the  world. It's fucking brilliant. You  know what I love most? This shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls out a can of SKOAL chewing tobacco and pinches o a chew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. This shit's fucking brilliant.  I just fucking love the fact that  you have kids driving around in pickup  trucks with a mouthful of this shit,  speeding their brains out. I gotta  bring a case of it home to my mates.  It's illegal back home, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does anyone want another?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want another drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's up for a night on the town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the worst possible thing he could've said as far Bobby is concerned. He is exhausted. The guys play the ho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Anyplace in particular?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear the China Club is a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit in a booth. Loud club music bombards their growi impatience. Bobby and Ricky strain to stay awake. The Wel drains a cocktail, watching a table-hopping MAGICIAN reli his enthusiastic audience of one as he presents him with Queen of diamonds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody hell! Brilliant! Did you see  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrace slips the performer a bill and he trots off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, about the business at hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all perk up and lean in. Tom drains his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone have any drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wave of dread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little Charlie, perhaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard you've got the best coke  in the States. The shit back home is  pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slipping Ricky some  bills) That shouldn't be a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky looks to Bobby, who shrugs. Ricky reluctantly goes to find drugs. Tom smiles and hugs Bobby and Horrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are the fucking best. I  swear, I didn't know about this whole  thing, but you guys are okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrace, Ricky, Tom, and Bobby are all packed like sardin in the toilet stall. Ricky hands Tom a glassine envelope  full of coke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slurring) God love you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens it with drunken abruptness, sending part of it's contents onto Bobby's jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, fuck me. Sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts rubbing the spillage from Bobby's lapel onto hi gums. Horrace prevents any more waste by taking the envel away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, mates. Now there isn't even  enough to go around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, man. It's all for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touched) No, really, mate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrace positions himself so that the Welshman can sniff  from his hand. The four large men all reposition themselv in the tiny stall, inevitably stepping on each other and  banging heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow, shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUTSIDE THE STALL, the attendant watches the feet shuffle they curse from within. INSIDE, Tom snorts a pile of coca from Horrace's outstretched hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck, that's good shit. So, what's  say we make a go of this and you  drop off the cash tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo settles to a STOP to drop off Horrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, here's what worries me. He said  he wants to meet up at a bar in Red  Hook. You know where that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooklyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must have that shit troughed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean 'troughed?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troughed off. Protected. Like, you  know, like he got a moat around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruiz tied in out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, man. No one is. They got some  Puerto Ricans and a new crop of fuckin  Irish immigrants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm half Irish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't fuck with those crazy, off- the-boat fuckin Irish. You heard of  the Westies?.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ran shit back in the Eighties.   Used to cut motherfuckers heads off  and sit them on the bar. That's back  when the Irish was making a play  against the Italians. I don't know  if they still around, but I don't  fuck with those motherfuckers just  in case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounds to me like everybody's  just a little jumpy. And since all  it is is a drop, the Welshman's got  nothing at stake. I say we go to his  'troughed off' bar. It'll calm his  nerves, we drop the bag, and we all  get back to our lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And not a word to Maxie. He'll shit  if he knew we crossed a bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all nod. Horrace gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull up to the Soho Grand. Ricky wakes Bobby, who be to doze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up brother. We're home. Go up  and get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby drags himself into his suite. He drops his drawers lays down. Instead of sleeping, he picks up the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chloe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Bobby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, baby. What are you doing awake?   Where's mommy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned, checking  watch) Mommy's not home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you take me to Color Me Mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Are you sure mommy's not home?  It's very late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEEBEEP... BEEBEEP... Shit. The pager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go, baby. I love you. Tell  mommy I called. You be a big girl  and be careful when you're alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. Come home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up, then dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...? Now...? Did Ricky call  yet...? See you in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits up, hunched over. He motivates reluctantly. He cl his way into the bathroom and rinses his face in a meagre attempt to wash away the cobwebs. He looks awful. The COL are beginning to INTENSIFY as sleep deprivation sets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby sits into the car once again. Jimmy pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't we waiting for Ricky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky's taken care of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taken care of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's getting there on his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby fights to clear his head and think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo pulls up, and Horrace steps in, talking on the p Horrace carries a BRIEFCASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car pulls away. Bobby has the no-sleep-sweats. He loo awful. No one greets anyone. There is a tension. Horrace on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (phone) Yeah... Yeah... Uhu... I can't really  talk now, but it's all going as  planned. If things change, I'll call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up. PAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick drop. In and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Ricky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky's taken care of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was uptown when I paged him. I  gave him the address. He's meeting  us there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: briefcase) That it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car crosses the Brooklyn Bridge and drives through  Brooklyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is watching and thinking as Brooklyn goes by. Horra seems distant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo passes the corner and settles in front of the ti worn Icarus Tavern. A young IRISH MAN stands out front smoking a fag. The pla is open, but the neon 'OPEN' sign is off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pop the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Ricky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess inside. Or he never made it.  Either way, I don't give a shit.   Let's get this over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two guys get out and enter the pub. Horrace carries t case of cash. The guy at the door watches them enter and  snuffs out his smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the old world gin mill. It's dark. There's a l aged wooden bar and oak booths. The floor boards are fade and bowed. A middle-aged BARTENDER reads the Post by the  oversized beer taps. He looks up over his reading glasses without expression. Two young Irish TOUGHS stand up from booth and lead the men into the back room. There is a sil tension. No sign of Ricky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even darker. They slowly walk in, sending cautious looks every corner. A simple round table sits in the center of  this sparse dining room. Three ROGUES sit around it, all  facing the door. Tom, the Welshman, sits with his back to the door. They all have pints before them. A muted  conversation ends as Tom follows their stares over his  shoulder to see Bobby and Horrace enter. Silence for a BE then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here they are, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (falsely relaxed) How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brilliantly. Care for a pint?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks, man. We got to head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, now. You just got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's alright, man. It's a little  early for me to drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This draws an uncomfortably bass chuckle from the seven d characters now surrounding them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonsense. We'll have three half pints  of lager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Irishman goes to fetch the drinks. Two of the Irishme pat them down for guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about that. Where's your mate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't make it. Here's the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrace places the case on the table. Its weight makes a  loud thunk as it hits the hardwood. He pops the catch and lifts the lid. Wow. That's a lot of money. The toughs los their poker faces as their knees weaken from the sight of it. Even Bobby has to swallow as the Devil blows on his n Tom fingers the stacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxious) Give me your marker, and we'll be on  our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom begins to write out a receipt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't yet vouch for the amount,  unless you want me to sit here and  count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, man, that's fine. Just put that  you took delivery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, in what takes only a matter of seconds, Bobby has a LOCKBLADE to his THROAT and Horrace takes a truncheon to gut, flooring him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck, man? Why? The money's  in your hand. Why you pulling this  shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is scared shit. He's more surprised than any of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I just hired these guys to watch  my back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfucker, we're handing you money.  What the hell we gonna pull?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your goddamn mouth! As far as  any of you are concerned, a gang of  spics took the bag. Understood? Grab  their wallets. I'll know where to  find each and every one of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know, I swear to God, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK. He takes one in the gut, violently losing his wind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bobby) If you and your boy set this up,  you're way out of your league.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're the one who better shut  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all turn to see RICKY standing tall with a PISTOL to the head of a tough with two beers. Ricky sips the third  lager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's only got six shots, he's bound  to miss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe I'm real lucky. I'll tell  you one thing, I'll waste every bullet  making sure you're dead if you don't  take that knife away from my friends  throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thug removes the blade from Bobby's neck. His eyes na as he looks at the gun. He notices something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a starter pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His gun's a starter pistol. I can  see the red plug in the barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The toughs begin to relax and converge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) Are you willing to risk your life  over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the moment proves enough of a distraction for Bobby t unload a damaging COMBINATION to his captor. He may not h what it takes to cut it as a professional boxer, but thes untrained goons are way outclassed. He drops one like a l weight. It's about to get ugly as weapons are raised. The The melee is cut short by a resounding VOICE calling from the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy the driver stands in the door aiming a Glock 45 at crowd. They all freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys, over in the corner. Leave  the hardware and your wallets on the  table. (to bartender) Make out an invoice on damages. You  got e-mail? (nods. Jimmy hands  him a card.) E-mail it to me. A check will arrive.  Call the number at the bottom and  tell them the Rook is code four.  Then destroy the card. (to Bobby) Nice. I'll let Maxie know you're  good in the pocket. (to Ricky) Staduch. (to the guys) Go. I'll take care of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things are about to get ugly. Bobby grabs the case. They  split.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get in. The limo pulls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrace peels out and Bobby, Ricky, Horrace, and the Red  Dragon all sit in silence catching their breath. Bobby ho the case. Looks are exchanged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Get me back to Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts) Take us right to Kennedy. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrace nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Ricky sit before Max. They look the worst we've ever seen them. They've obviously not slept or changed ye and flew right out after the melee. Maxie looks at the open case of cash. A long, tense BEAT of unclear reaction. Is Maxie mad or h Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws them each a bundle off the top of the pile of b Ten grand stacks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never intended to test you two to  that extent, but you both came  through. I should've been informed  there was a flag on the play, but  I'll take that up with Ruiz. I made  a few calls back East. Those punks  weren't tied in with anyone. As for  the Welshman, he wasn't in on it. He  was just plain dumb. As for you,  Ricky, your draw will go towards a  new carpet cleaning van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Max --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, as for you, Bobby, you just  moved up a notch. Your days of  fighting for crumbs is through. Take  a week off, come back, and we'll  talk about the next thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There won't be a next thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a few days --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need a few days. I'm gonna  settle down with Jess. She's through  dancing. We're opening a restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to ruin your fairy tale, but  I've been paying Jess' rent for six  months. She's got to keep dancing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby throws his stack of cash at Maxie. Ricky grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's through too. Thank you for the  opportunity, Max. We'll see you  around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They rise to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) You got a lot to learn, kid. Say hi  to Jess for me.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The Trans Am pulls up in front of Jess' house. Bobby and  Ricky both pop out. We catch the end of a conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, we were practically made...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drop you off in a minute. I  want to see if the baby's up. You  wanna come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'll wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby trots up the stairs. Ricky lights a smoke and watch him go. We linger on his look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. The living room looks like a disaster are The sink is full of dishes, stacked high above the counte Dirty clothes are strewn all over. Half eaten plates of f are on the coffee table and bags of carry-out containers pizza boxes lie about. In the center of it all, Chloe sit alone watching a Hollywood Hills brushfire on the news. S looks up with the solemnity of one much older.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's mommy? Did she leave you  alone again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chloe looks to the back room as she sips from her juice b Bobby sees a MIRROR and COKE laid out on the table. He gr his teeth and goes for the bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby bursts in to find Jess in bed with the HORNY BACHEL whose nose he broke the week before. The guy jumps in fea Jess is startled and coked out of her mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never promised you anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you let her see this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just so you know, I bought you out  with Maxie. I suggest you leave while  you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you get it? I don't want to  leave. This is who I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you the truth, I don't give a  shit for me. But that little girl is  so special, and you're gonna fuck  her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses to go, but is interrupted by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Take her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to take her with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Bobby's look we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby walks in. Chloe looks up at him. A tense silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, uh... Listen, hon. Mommy thinks  it's a good idea if, just for a while,  if you and me go on a trip --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before he can finish, his stammering is cut short by her  bolting across the room and into his arms. She squeezes him with all her might. We see Bobby's relief and happiness over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELES
dialogues.text: We FADE UP on a beautiful sunny morning traveling on an e desert road. The only car visible is Bobby's Trans Am in deep background, leaving the mountains behind. The CAMERA TRACKS BACKWARDS along the road as the car closes slowly. hear Chloe's angelic voice as she sings a melody. As the draws closer, we see Bobby, still in the clothes from the trip, driving. There is luggage packed for a journey. Bob looks content. When the car finally settles into a TWO-SH through the windshield, we notice SMOKE coming from the b seat. A moment later, Ricky sits up behind them. He is ha awake and cranky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, you got the sweetest voice I  ever heard, but Uncle Ricky's gotta  sleep. I've been driving all night,  Princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh, c'mon, baby. It's quiet time.   Isn't it quiet time, Bobby? Bobby?   Tell her it's quiet time Bobby.   Please tell her it's quiet time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby smirks and accelerates, passing CAMERA, which PANS watch them speed off into the big sky horizon.
